intro: Theophrasta andrea, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its velvety, thick leaves and showy, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its flowers are usually purple or violet in color, with five petals and a distinctive calyx. Theophrasta andrea is widely cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its aesthetic appeal and ability to thrive in indoor environments.
